topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5300361763687262313a0100#post_5300361763687262313a0100
The name is in the first episode where they're debating what "fooly cooly" means and go on this long "wtf are they talking about debate?" and afterwords it clicks of, "wow there's no way any censor would have realized what the fuck's going on" cause honestly I don't think anyone knew what was going on in the show.

Fooly cooly is like crystal meth in tv format.  99% of the time you won't know what is going on.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Urf, I'm really worried for my guinea pig.

I have no idea how, but she broke her front legs' nails so badly that they've curled up into green balls (not mold nor fungus, thank god) that are too big to be snipped off with baby nail clippers. Her cagemate's nails appear to be fine, so I have no fucking clue how she could have done this to herself, but I have no idea how to get them off (chipping them away slowly with a baby nail clipper isn't an option, and I can't use an adult one). She's walking and interacting normally, but I can't just leave those things on.

Yesh.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5300f9c863687277b5ea0100#post_5300f9c863687277b5ea0100

Take her to the vet. Or is not an option in this case?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5301097863687252ee9b0000#post_5301097863687252ee9b0000

Can't, unfortunately. I'm on vacation in the middle of nowhere and there's no vets that take guinea pigs around. I'm going to soak her nails in warm water and see if maybe some of the green is just collected gunk, not actual nail.

It doesn't help that's she's pissed at me because I keep taking her out of her cage to try to whittle down her nails. She's usually pretty friendly and even walks up to the cage door, waiting for me to pick her up, but she's been running away and purring deeply at me, which is guinea pig language for "I don't like what you're doing, leave me alone". I'm half certain the other pig knows that her friend's annoyed with me; I swear the thing is giving me nasty looks.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53010cce63687251f3490100#post_53010cce63687251f3490100

Ok, from where I'm looking, it looks like an infection. Maybe from having scrachted something in her cage.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53010e09636872541c250200#post_53010e09636872541c250200

It looks pretty bad from above, but from where I was holding her, the color seems to have come from dragging her broken nails across crap (literally) and hay. Guinea pigs get coatings on their nails like this all the time; people actual call them poop shoes.

Still, wouldn't hurt to check it out, anyway.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442
